meanings.definition: Persuading or enticing someone to do something by using flattery or gentle pressure.
meanings.sent1: She was coaxing her cat out from under the bed with a treat.
meanings.sent2: The salesman was coaxing the customer to buy the latest model.
meanings.sent3: The children were coaxing the shy classmate to join their game during recess.
meanings.sent4: The sun was coaxing the flowers to bloom with its warm rays.
meanings.sent5: The coach was coaxing the team to give their best performance in the upcoming match.

meanings.definition: The act of persuading or enticing someone to do something by using flattery or gentle pressure.
meanings.sent1: Her coaxing finally convinced him to try the new restaurant.
meanings.sent2: The coaxing of the children led to a successful fundraiser for the school.
meanings.sent3: The coaxing of the puppy with a toy made everyone in the room smile.
meanings.sent4: The coaxing of the wind on the leaves created a soothing rustling sound.
meanings.sent5: The coaxing of the waves against the shore was a calming lullaby for the beachgoers.
